result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
3:00 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Antoine D Morton in court. 

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. 
The Court goes over the Petition of Appointed of Counsel with the Defendant. 
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing November 1, 2022. 
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO GO TO THE BUSINESS CENTER (Rm. 112) RIGHT AFTER COURT TO SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.
The Court tolls the time limits for a prelim hearing and adjourn the matter.
Hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Antoine D Morton
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W Moreland blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-07-2022)
Prior: 5668 N 95Th St, Milwaukee, WI 53225

DEFENDANT PREVIOUSLY POSTED $2,000.00, NEEDS TO POST AN ADDITIONAL $2,000.00.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Comply with all conditions in Waukesha County Case 22CF1276.

1:54 PM Defendant Antoine D Morton in court, in custody.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Court quashes warrant.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant states he was not evaluated by the Public Defenders office and was just brought here from Milwaukee County.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court will set matter for status of counsel on Tuesday to check on the custody status of defendant as he is uncertain if he will be able to post the additional $2,000.
Hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Initial appearance on October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
